note.p: Birth: Percy Street, Newcastle upon Tyne, Northumberland, England (14 August 1737)
Burial: The family vault at Charlton, Kent

Career: Hewer in a coal pit, Long Benton; became a teacher; opened a mathematical school, Newcastle (1760), where John Scott (FRS 1793) was one of his pupils; undertook additional private coaching; Professor of Mathematics, Royal Military Academy, Woolwich (1773); resigned Professorship (1809); retired to Bedford Row, London
